text.0: may we the pious win much food by prayer may agni with fair light pervade each act.
text.1: he the observer of the heavenly laws of gods and of the race of mortal man.
text.2: he who is germ of waters germ of woods germ of all things that move not and that move.
text.3: to him even in the rock and in the house immortal one he cares for all mankind.
text.4: agni is lord of riches for the man who serves him readily with sacred songs.
text.5: protect these beings thou with careful thought knowing the races both of gods and men.
text.6: whom many dawns and nights unlike make strong whom born in law all things that move and stand.
text.7: he hath been won herald who sits in light making effectual all our holy works.
text.8: thou settest value on our cows and woods all shall bring tribute to us to the light.
text.9: men have served thee in many and sundry spots parting as twere an aged fathers wealth.
text.10: like a brave archer like one skilled and bold a fierce avenger so he shines in fight.
